intro: Solenandra ixoroides subsp. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leafed screw pine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or wetland areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in tropical regions.
